{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3241917,"name":"Omer Prag","username":"Omer_Prag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/omer_prag/{size}/216472_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-17T12:29:52.119Z","cooked":"

It’s a problem that we’ve been aware of in our team for a couple of years now - we can’t seem to use slave motors in test mode. And I wonder, is it a bug in our code or if other teams are experiencing the same issue?

Not directly related to your problem, but people have generally agreed that “follower motor” is a nicer/better term to use. I’d suggest editing your post/thread title.

I’ve experienced the same issues with simulation, HOWEVER it only seems to occur with the Spark MAX. TalonFX/TalonSRX motor controllers seem to do followers properly in sim.

Exactly. Our solution is just ignoring the problem and running our dashboard testing in tele mode and it works just fine, but I would like to know more about this problem and if there is anything to do about it.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-10-17T12:59:01.781Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":42.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":442598,"topic_slug":"using-follower-motors-in-test","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":58266,"username":"Omer_Prag","name":"Omer Prag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/omer_prag/{size}/216472_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60828,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-follower-motors-in-test/442598/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3242034,"name":"Cory","username":"TytanRock","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tytanrock/{size}/167849_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-17T15:39:11.394Z","cooked":"

This stems from the Test function first putting every Sendable object into a “SafeState” when Test Mode is enabled.
For TalonFX, this involves calling the stopMotor() method resulting in a NeutralOut Control Request.
So if you only called setControl(followRequest) once on init, it gets overwritten when Test is enabled, and never set again, resulting in the follower no longer following.

I suspect if you call the setControl(followRequest) continuously, or at least on teleop/auto init, your problem will go away.

Generator","slug":"unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator","posts_count":13,"reply_count":7,"highest_post_number":13,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-01-13T09:02:42.324Z","last_posted_at":"2025-01-16T21:21:40.794Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-01-16T21:21:40.794Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"We’re
